aspect.name: Genomics
aspect.subtitle: Genome annotation
aspect.intro-text: The gene structure and other genome annotation in FlyMine are provided by a variety of curated source databases. In most cases FlyMine includes all genome features that have chromosomal locations (e.g. genes and repeat regions).

aspect.name: Gene Expression
aspect.intro-text:
Microarray-based gene expression data for Drosophila melanogaster from FlyAtlas, as well as from selected data sets.

Probe set data from Affymetrix.

aspect.name: Transcriptional Regulation
aspect.subtitle:
Regulatory regions and
transcription factor binding sites
aspect.intro-text: Regulatory regions and transcription factor binding sites in Drosophila melanogaster from FlyReg, REDfly and FlyBase.

aspect.name: DrosDel
aspect.subtitle:
P-element insertions
and deletions
aspect.intro-text: DrosDel P-element insertion and deletion locations.

aspect.name: Tiling Path
aspect.subtitle: Microarray Tiling Primers
aspect.intro-text: Primers designed to tile across whole genomes or regions of genomes.

aspect.name: INDAC
aspect.subtitle:
Long oligos from the
International Drosophila Array Consortium
aspect.intro-text: Long oligos from the International Drosophila Array Consortium.

aspect.name: RNAi
aspect.subtitle: RNA interference
aspect.intro-text: Results from cell-based RNAi interference experiments from the Drosophila RNAi screening center and from in vivo experiments in Caenorhabditis elegans. By using orthologues, gene phenotypes in other organisms can be inferred from the C. elegans RNAi experiments.

aspect.name: Comparative Genomics
aspect.subtitle: Orthologues and paralogues
aspect.intro-text: Orthologues and Paralogues. Orthologues are equivalent genes in different species that evolved from a common ancestor by speciation. Paralogues are genes from the same homologous superfamily found in another part of the genome of a particular taxon. Paralogues are the result of gene duplication.

aspect.name: Proteins
aspect.subtitle:
Protein and
proteomics data
aspect.intro-text: Protein annotation, including family and domain annotation, from UniProt and InterPro.

aspect.name: Protein Interactions
aspect.subtitle: IntAct
aspect.intro-text: High-throughput 2-hybrid protein interaction datasets for D. melanogaster, C. elegans and S. cerevisiae. The datasets were downloaded in Proteomics Standards Initiative molecular interaction PSI-MI format from the IntAct database.

aspect.name: Protein Structure
aspect.subtitle: 3-D protein structures
aspect.intro-text: 3-D protein structures from the Mizuguchi lab.

aspect.name: Gene Ontology
aspect.intro-text: Gene Ontology (GO) annotations for Drosophila, C. elegans and A. gambiae. The GO annotations are 'attached' to Genes and so each Gene has a reference (link) to a list of its GO annotations (if available).
